post.body: I'm having a Denny Crane moment...which one (didn't you see coming)?
Seriously! There's a real benefit to having older brothers and sisters who handed down all their old 45 rpm records! lol
I prefer a nice sourdough, thanks. "Anthology of Bread" was one of my favorite albums as a teenager.
Bread. What do I win?? LOL
That has been known to be a leading indicator, yes. LOL
@pinkelephantpun: Sooooo...once a month or so? ;) (j/k)
@pinkelephantpun: Oh, my.
Precisely the reason that jerk needs to retire. Judd Gregg cares about one thing: Judd Gregg.
Amazing that Harry Reid can smell tourists but not the overwhelming smell of BS that wafts from his office.
I've seen others are having an issue with TweetDeck this morning, too, incidentally. (If that helps...)
Oh, I'm sure. It was just a rude awakening when I went in to make my annual benefits enrollment selections! lol
Perhaps it's a feature? lol
Yeah, I thought as much. LOL I'm all about usability, though. :)
Ive never tried Twhirl, actually. Maybe I'll do that today to see if there's a 3rd client I'm equally as ambivalent about
I go back and forth between TweetDeck and the website. Can't make up my mind on which I'd rather use.
I think I can oblige! :)
If Im tagged, does that mean Im "it." lol
Interesting...might be worth compiling! lol
is that a rhetorical question? :)
I know! I feel weird being happy about it, but I'll take it and be happy.
Oh, it's morning, alright. LOL
If you set me up like that, man, I'm *gonna* spike it right back atcha. lol
I was gonna say....... ;)
Well, no, because Katie and the rest of the Media think that Government SHOULD be providing Gov't $ to PP...
Oh, absolutely. I mean, Philly parking laws seem weird, but if its posted just take the ticket and pay it already!
Me too! It's hard to feel sorry for the dummies they encounter both on the street and at the impound lot, though. :)
And this is season 2! Season 1 is equally as entertaining. :)
My girlfriend and I love Parking Wars! It makes me never want to park in Philly...EVER!
I prefer to think of it as "realism" as opposed to "pessimism." lol
We'll have to agree to disagree, then. :)
All I'm saying is that she's the least qualified and least diplomatic person that Obama could have picked for SoS.
And she's NOT?!? She's nuclear! LOL Richardson was at least UN Ambassador and is pretty favorably viewed.
Bill Richardson, for starters. He got foreign policy and ambassadorial/diplomatic experience. He's wasted at Commerce.
Besides, tghis was negotiated before the convention. She was definitely going to get a prominent role in return for delegates.
Shrewd, yes. Diplomatic? No. She doesn't do anything that doesnt benefit her first. :)
Besides, she's now this nation's chief diplomat with no diplomat or foreign policy experience. lol
Not at all. Campaign politics are rarely ever diplomatic. Besides, "keep your friends close & enemies closer." lol
That hardly speaks to diplomacy. She got the nom because it was politically expedient.
He could have done lots better, too. HRC is anything BUT a diplomat. lol
absolutely no offense meant. To me (and many) theres a big difference between your situation & what I had meant.
@Linc4Justice: Clearly *someone* out here must know a newly-escaped mental patient perfect for us to introduce to Linc. LOL
@Linc4Justice: It *IS* some good vittles, I have to say! @JaneDivided is WAY too good to me.
She's ALL MINE and I'd be completely lost without her. :)
LMAO
It really is! She makes it with green beans for me because I can't have corn anymore due to diverticulitis. She ROCKS!
Yeah...I agree. I'm just glad Berman and Braga are GONE!
You won't be disappointed, then. That's a very Garak/Sisko-centric episode and now I want to watch it again!
"In the Pale Moonlight" is one of my favorite DS9 episodes. No huge battle but Sisko has to bring the Romulans into the war.
There are some MASSIVE battle sequences in DS9. They're great! Those TNG episodes are all-time faves, too.
I always thought that DS9 had great character development and conflict between characters--something Gene never really wanted
Totally. First of all...her first command and she gets the ship lost! Not a good start. lol
By the time that show got to season 5, it was "The Doctor and Seven of Nine Show." lol I'm a DS9'er. :)
you just described every episode of Star Trek: Voyager. lol
There's not a bad track on that LP, man. :) I saw them this summer and they did a lot of pre-80's stuff which was surprising.
It's one of mine, too. It's probably the first full Chicago album I listened to growing up.
Favorite Chicago song? There's two: Vote for Me from Chicago 11 (I think) and Searchin' So Long from Chicago VII
No kidding...and everyone else on the planet has seen it coming for months.
That it did, indeed. lol
I was a Dolphins fan for years which is weird because Ive never lived in FL. :)
I have issues.
I mean, why not, right? I love women...@JaneDivided in particular! I'm a male lesbian---I should be able to call in! LOL
I'm not going to call in "gay," but I *might* call in "lesbian."
RE Sununu - Because the current party chair is young and had run the party into the ground. Sununu's a known quantity.
I'm especially annoyed by it when it happens in...say...work email. It's just a *poor* reflection on people, IMO.
True...I almost used chicken salad vs. chicken...well, you know.
True, but he's promised the moon and is going to deliver cream cheese. The expectation lowering has already begun.
...and continue to lower expectations. lol
My pet peeve is when people type "loose" and mean "lose." That, and the non-word "irregardless."
...and not entirely implausible considering how little they'd have to achieve to be classified as an "improvement." ha!
I don't know...I almost think that's an insult to perfectly good monkeys everywhere. lol
Indeed we do! I think I'd stage a revolt if they ever took LFOD off. :)
Yeah, not so much. LOL
Yeah, I don't think I'm getting my WH Christmas card this year. Might be something to do with my calls on Compean & Ramos. ;)
LOL...good one. Reminds me of an old Eddie Murphy bit. :)
No doubt! He should have picked up the shoes up and thrown them right back at the guy. I'm thinking Texans HIT what they aim at. ;)
And I have the personal knowledge that Blago is FULL OF IT. lol
As I'm fond of saying, "conservatism needs no modifier."
I nominate @peggyolson for a Shorty Award in #advertising because she's a pioneer in the field.
You and me, both. Now I just tune in my 80's channel on XM. LOL
Now I think you're being too kind. ;)
Agreed...and all he wants to do is yell. He's never had an original thought on that radio program.
*Everything* upsets Hannity. Even the people who agree with him. He's a big whiner...
Jason-just wanted to let you know my tv finally was fixed today! Thanks for your help. Where can I write corp hq w/feedback?
I think that's probably a good idea. I always feel "guilty" about posting pop culture on my politics blog, though. Dunno why
Best Buy was just here! Good news: They diagnosed the problem in 2 minutes. Bad news: I have to wait another week for the part to come in.
60 minutes and ticking for my Best Buy window. Somehow, I don't have a good feeling about this...
Link on Drudge says oil prices have fallen to a 3 1/2 year low. Unfortunately, so has my 401(k). UGH.
Yep....still waiting for Best Buy! LOL I love four hour windows. 90 minutes down, two and a half hours to go!
Is expecting someone from Best Buy to come today to look at his television! (Between 8 and Noon EST, of course.)
is rocking some Starsky and Hutch reruns while he tries to get comfy.
OJ "didn't want to steal anything from anyone?" Suuure. That's why you show up at a hotel room with weapons to get your stuff back. Idiot.
I *really* can't stand O'Reilly. There's only one person he's "looking out for," and that's Bill O'Reilly. *sigh*
is just back from the Doc's. Apparently it's *just* diverticulitis. I never thought I'd be as happy as I am with that diagnosis...
Gulf Oil CEO says gas could hit $1/gal. next year? Let's hope my 401(k) doesn't keep pace with that! SHEESH!
is not looking forward to his CAT scan later today. *sigh*
Off to bed. Thanks, #tcot, for getting me to 350 followers! It was a pleasure to meet so many Tweeple today! Cheers...
http://twitpic.com/qsbs - Shepherd's Pie!
is excited! @JaneDivided is making Shepherd's Pie for dinner--the kind I can eat, that is: sans corn! WOOOOO!!
NYT takes a mortgage against their HQ to help with cash flow. I hope it's a sub-prime mortgage. ;)
Wow...just hit 400 Tweeps following me. Thanks, #tcot! :)
listening to Shatner on the Stern show. I mean, how could I not? He's Shatner!
Wow...the Pats pull one out of their butts today. #patriots
Barack: "It's going to get worse." NO KIDDING? How absolutely prescient of him! UGH
Wow, I wish we could get players like Deion Branch in New Engl...oh...wait. Yeah. #patriots
Matt Cassel is looking more like Drew Bledsoe than Tom Brady. UGH #patriots
Facebook and Twitter--the deal that almost was... http://tinyurl.com/55htk3
Tweet #1000: Rod Blagojevich taken into custody by the Feds! http://tinyurl.com/67r9w6
just realized he had "New Hampshier" spelled wrong in his profile since he joined Twitter a while back. FAIL. lol
I'm blowing off my employer's "holiday party" because I cant drink the free booze due to the antibiotics and I cant bring @JaneDivided.
http://twitpic.com/rqdp - My broken USS Reliant ornament. It wont light up.
It's forty degrees warmer than it was yesterday here in New Hampshire. Maybe I'll get my Xmas tree before it gets really cold again. ;)
just narrowly averted a crisis: the tipping over of the Chritmis tree! @JaneDivided and I were able to get it before it tipped all the way!
The guy throwing shoes at Bush couldn't hit him from less than 20 feet away?? And he calls himself a journalist! Puh-LEEZE!!!
So far, I'm one of the lucky ones here in NH that has power. I hear there are possibly 200k without and Gov. has declared emergency.
I think that all 200K people without power in NH have decided to go to the Manchester-area Dunkin Donuts shops en masse. They're all MOBBED.
New Blog: Congress Getting $4,700 Pay Raise... http://tinyurl.com/6wfk2l
about to brave the stores and try to complete my Chritmis shopping. UGH.
Panel discussion now w/ James Kalb, author of "The Tyranny of Liberalism" on WEZS.com. #tcot
Settling in for the final hour of "The Advocates" on WEZS.com--the conservative voice of the Lakes Region! #TCOT
is live as a guest panelist on WEZS.com's "The Advocates" right now. Listen live online!
is live now on WEZS.com with Niel Young on "The Advocates." The conservative voice of NH's Lakes Region.
Getting ready to appear on WEZS & WEZS.com at 9:30...
New Blog: Radio Appearance, Saturday 12/20... http://tinyurl.com/3r2ewh
If this is what being a "compassionate conservative" is, then I'm happy to be a spiteful, blood-thirsty one. Thanks, W...for nothing. #tcot
IM ready to throw MY shoe at George Bush at this point over this auto bailout, for cryin out loud! (Not that I would EVER, but, you know...)
doesn't want you to waste your question.
